variants.Description in input context: PINK1 accumulation on mitochondria is necessary and sufficient for Parkin recruitment.

Material used.Description: Mitochondria were isolated from Drosophila melanogaster cells for the mitophagy assay.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 accumulation on mitochondria led to increased mitophagy and activation of Parkin.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for the mitophagy assay.

Technical replicates.Description: No technical replicates were mentioned in the literature for this experiment.

Basic positive control.Description: Mitochondria from wild-type Drosophila melanogaster cells were used as a positive control for mitophagy assay.

Basic negative control.Description: Mitochondria from Drosophila melanogaster cells treated with ATP were used as a negative control for mitophagy assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student’s t-test was used for statistical analysis of the mitophagy assay data.

Approved assay.Description: The mitophagy assay is generally used for studying the relationship between PINK1 and Parkin in Parkinson’s disease.
